title: enhancedchannelmanager
description:
Fixed EPG matching to properly balance HD preference with call sign quality.

Issues fixed:
- US | 5050 - FYI: now prefers FYIChannelHD(FYIHD).us over FYI(FYISD).us
- US | 5051 - GET TV: now prefers getHD(GETHD).us over get(GETTVS).us
- US | 5079 - Lifetime Movie: now prefers LMNHD(LMNHD).us
- US | 5086 - MGM+: now prefers MGM+HD(MGMHD).us over MGM+West(MGMW).us
- US | 5092 - Ovation: now prefers OvationHD(OVATNHD).us over Ovation(OVATION).us
- US | 5097 - Pursuit: now prefers PursuitChannelHD(PURSTHD).us over PursuitUP(PRSTUP).us
- US | 5102 - Reelz: now prefers ReelzChannelHD(REELZHD).us over REELZ(VIZREEL).us
- US | 5113 - Tastemade Travel: now prefers TastemadeTravel(TMTRAVEL).us (actually this one should still work from v65)
- US | 5116 - TCM: now prefers TurnerClassicMoviesHD(TCMHD).us over TCM.us
- US | 5125 - TV Land: now prefers TVLandHD(TVLNDHD).us over TVLand(TVLAND).us

Root cause:
Previous logic (v65) prioritized call sign match quality over HD preference. This caused issues where non-HD variants with slightly better call sign matches (e.g., TVLAND exact match) were preferred over HD variants with good-but-not-exact call signs (e.g., TVLNDHD).

Solution:
Combined HD preference with call sign scoring. Now:
- When comparing HD vs non-HD, prefer HD UNLESS:
  - The non-HD has a MUCH better call sign (score difference >= 2)
  - AND the HD variant has a poor call sign (score <= 1)
- This means NOSEY (score 3) still beats VIZNOSE-HD (score 0)
- But TVLNDHD (score 2) now beats TVLAND (score 3) because diff is only 1

Fixed 500 error when creating new group during bulk channel creation.

Root cause: The code was calling api.createChannelGroup() directly when the user selected 'Create new group' in the bulk create modal. This called the Dispatcharr API immediately, but the Dispatcharr API returned a 400 Bad Request (possibly due to the group name already existing). The backend caught this and returned a 500 Internal Server Error.

Changes:
1. Added 'newGroupName' field to createChannel API call spec
2. Updated stageCreateChannel to accept newGroupName parameter  
3. Updated commit logic to:
   - Collect all unique new group names from staged createChannel operations
   - Create those groups first before creating channels
   - Map group names to their new IDs
   - Use the mapped ID when creating channels
4. Updated App.tsx handleBulkCreateFromGroup to pass newGroupName instead of calling API directly

Now when the user selects 'Create new group':
- The group creation is staged along with the channels
- The group is only created in Dispatcharr when the user clicks 'Done' (commits)
- If the user discards, no orphaned group is left in Dispatcharr

title: enhancedchannelmanager
description:
Fixed EPG matching to prefer call signs that better match the channel name.

Issues fixed:
- US | 5089 - Nosey: now prefers Nosey(NOSEY).us over Nosey(VIZNOSE).us
- US | 5097 - Pursuit: now prefers PursuitChannelHD(PURSTHD).us over PursuitUP(PRSTUP).us
- US | 5102 - Reelz: now prefers ReelzChannelHD(REELZHD).us over REELZ(VIZREEL).us
- US | 5113 - Tastemade Travel: now prefers TastemadeTravel(TMTRAVEL).us over TastemadeTravel(VIZTASTR).us
- US | 5116 - TCM: now prefers TurnerClassicMoviesHD(TCMHD).us over TCM.us
- US | 5117 - The Cowboy Channel: now prefers HD variant
- US | 5120 - The Pet Collective: now prefers ThePetCollective(PETCOLL).us over ThePetCollective(XALPTCL).us

Root cause:
The call sign matching logic only compared call signs when both EPG entries had them, and was positioned after HD preference in sort priority. Call signs like VIZNOSE, VIZREEL, XALPTCL don't contain the channel name, while NOSEY, REELZHD, PETCOLL do.

Solution:
- Added a call sign scoring function that rates how well the call sign matches the channel name:
  - Score 3: exact match (call sign equals normalized name)
  - Score 2: call sign starts with normalized name (e.g., REELZHD starts with REELZ)
  - Score 1: significant common prefix (60%+ overlap)
  - Score 0: no meaningful match
- Moved call sign matching BEFORE HD preference in sort priority
- Now handles entries without call signs gracefully (score 0)

Add WebSocket integration with Dispatcharr to show real-time EPG refresh progress like the Dispatcharr UI does.

ECM polls the REST API every 2 seconds during refresh, but can only see:
- status: 'fetching' or 'parsing'
- last_message: Only updated when operation completes

- 'Downloading' with speed/progress

- 'Parsing channels' with batch progress
- 'Parsing programs' with percentage

- Dispatcharr WebSocket endpoint: ws://host:port/ws/
- Message type: 'update' with 'data' containing progress info
- Actions: 'downloading', 'extracting', 'parsing_channels', 'parsing_programs'
- Updates sent via channel_layer.group_send() to 'updates' group

comments.author: lecaptainc
comments.text:
Fixed regional variant detection to catch more patterns like WestCoastFeed.

Issue: 'MotorTrend' was matching 'MotorTrend(WestCoastFeed)(MTPHD).us' over 'MOTORTRENDHD(MTHD).us' because 'WestCoastFeed' wasn't being detected as a regional variant.

Fix: Expanded the regional pattern to match more variants:
- Old: /\((Pacific|East|West|Central|Mountain)\)/i
- New: /\((Pacific|East(?:ern)?(?:Feed)?|West(?:ern)?(?:Coast)?(?:Feed)?|Central|Mountain)\)/i

Now matches:
- Pacific
- East, Eastern, EastFeed, EasternFeed
- West, Western, WestCoast, WestCoastFeed, WesternFeed
- Central
- Mountain

Since 'MotorTrend' has no region hint, it defaults to preferring East, and the WestCoastFeed variant is now correctly deprioritized.

2. Non-regional variants (if no matching regional)

- 'FYI West' → prefers Pacific variant
- 'FYI East' → prefers East variant

2. For short names, don't prioritize exact matches over prefix matches in sorting
3. Added special punctuation matching - prefer EPG entries that share special chars like '!' with the original channel name

Now 'E!' will match 'E!Entertainment' because:
- Both 'E.us' (exact) and 'E!EntertainmentTelevisionHD' (prefix) are found
- The '!' in the channel name prefers the EPG entry with '!' in its TVG-ID

title: Fix article stripping breaking AWE channel matching

comments.author: lecaptainc
comments.text:
Fixed article stripping breaking AWE channel matching.

Root cause: The regex `/^(the|a|an)(?=[a-z])/` was stripping the 'a' from 'awe' because:
- 'a' matches the article pattern
- 'we' follows (a letter follows after 'a')

This turned 'awe' into 'we', which couldn't match the call sign 'awe' (from AWEHD).

Fix: Added minimum length requirement (4+ chars) for the remaining text after stripping an article.
- 'awe' → 'we' (2 chars) - too short, no stripping → remains 'awe' ✓
- 'thebobrosschannel' → 'bobrosschannel' (14 chars) - long enough, strips → 'bobrosschannel' ✓
